definition: to get off the main topic/to digress
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: You are off the subject. I am lost in your words.
sentences.chinese: 你走题了，你的话让我迷茫。

sentences.english: Start a blog on your favorite topic, else you will always run out of content.
sentences.chinese: 从你最喜欢的话题开始，否则你就会走题，不知所云。

definition: to digress/to stray from the subject
to digress/to stray from the topic
to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely
to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
to digress/to get sidetracked/to go off on a tangent
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
